column3: Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/f8904d0c2b5a6c95d0b8abc0baffdcb6edf81a6e for binaries and test log.\nThis test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/cu

Actually, the total amount of bitcoins doesn't _have_ to fit in a single int64_t, just the total transacted in a given transaction... Also, changing MAX_MONEY really has no effect on increasing the supply.\n
It's much more likely that COIN will be increased eventually than MAX_MONEY. And by that time, 128 bit integers are probably the norm.\n

@laanwj  I suspect he was just trying to make a lame argument that we could just inflate the supply by flipping a knob here.

It would have been more amusing if he'd made the correct change (in GetBlockValue()) and then pull tester had rejected it, demonstrating how just changing it doesn't work.
